column3:
<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Charmont's eyes have a faraway look about them, as if he is thinking great thoughts.
Wait at the specified location, use the herbicidal tincture on the massive berkanan, then slay it.
What luck! You are just the gallant sort I was in search of.
You see, I've whipped up an experimental new tincture, one that brings low a certain type of fiend. I had hoped a brave adventurer might test its efficacy for me in the field.

And since you're here, perhaps <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> could fill that role? Good. Now then, about this solution of mine! With the help of some gleaners, I've crafted a concoction that can intenerate even the hardest of seedkin's casings, allowing one to make quick work of the beasts.

Or so my hypothesis goes, anyway. Alas, my genius remains untested and thus unproven─which is where you come in. One so well versed in the ways of war should have no trouble at all verifying the tincture's efficacy, I should think.

Based on the information I have ascertained, an oversized berkanan can be found wandering about to the west of Logistikon Beta. Douse that sadistic seedkin in my newest nostrum and bash it into a bloody pulp for me, would you?
What wonders I'm capable of confecting. Well, I suppose we don't know as of yet whether this particular experiment of mine is a wonder...though I can hardly imagine it is anything but!
Why, not a scratch on you. I take this to mean my serum did its job, then?
Is that so? Goodness, my genius is rather startling, isn't it? That was a tincture most hastily thrown together─nary a thought was put into it.

What? This is most disappointing. You have rendered this whole exercise utterly meaningless. Still, it is impressive that you were able to bring the beast to its bark-covered knees when so many others have failed before you.
At any rate, I thank you for services rendered. Here, for your troubles. Well then, I must return to my pondering─these theories of mine won't hypothesize themselves!
